description: Packed with vegetables and a warm, lightly spiced broth, lentil soup is one of the easiest meals you can make in your Instant Pot.
headline: Instant Pot Lentil Soup Is Fragrant, Filling, and Oh-So Easy

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 1 week or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Instant Pot Lentil Soup Is Fragrant, Filling, and Oh-So Easy
recipeIngredient: 2 (32-ounce) boxes low-sodium vegetable or chicken broth

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the following, placing them all in a 6-quart or larger Instant Pot or electric pressure cooker: Dice 1 medium yellow onion and 3 medium celery stalks, peel and cut 3 medium carrots into 1/2-inch thick rounds, and mince 3 garlic cloves.

Add 2 cups lentils, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 2 boxes vegetable or chicken broth, and 1 can fire-roasted diced tomatoes and their juices. Stir to combine.
Lock the lid on and make sure the pressure valve is closed. Set to cook under HIGH pressure for 15 minutes. It will take about 20 minutes to come up to pressure.
When the cook time is up, quick release the pressure. Add 5 ounces baby spinach and gently stir to combine.

video.description:
Just the thought of lentil soup makes me warm with comfort. You see, I have a very clear vision of what I expect when I think about this soup. It all stems from the New York City deli where I was first introduced to this soup over a decade ago, and eventually learned to expect the same brothy, warmly spiced bowl studded with vegetables most places I ordered it. 

These days I'm making it at home rather than ordering it, but it is the cozy, crave-worthy lentil soup I've been enjoying for years: A perfectly spiced brothy soup with a hint of smoky warmth, filled with tender lentils that are soft, but not mushy, and a scattering of thick-cut carrots and celery, and ribbons of bright spinach.

And perhaps best of all, I created a quick-cooking version (with no saut√©ing or leftover ingredients!) that's wildly simple to pull off and leaves you with plenty of freezer-friendly leftovers for days to come. 

See full recipe post [HERE](https://www.thekitchn.com/instant-pot-lentil-soup-23105244)
video.name: Instant Pot Lentil Soup
